title: Since Cassiopeia is going to be the first to get the "Grounded" debuff...
body:
Who else is planned to get said debuff?

Also, who do you think SHOULD get the new "Grounded" crowd control?

Here are a few I can think of who could use it:

{{champion:27}} - Add it to Mega Adhesive to give him some neat utility.
{{champion:91}} - Because "CutAnkles" isn't nearly good enough.
{{champion:134}} - Add it to her W when she maxes it out. Gives her some real nasty surprises.
{{champion:34}} - Honestly, her crowd controls are outdated. Add this to her ultimate while removing its AS slow.
{{champion:45}} - Once his Event Horizon finishes forming, it should do this to people inside of it. There, now it's REALLY useful. Nerf the cooldown if needed.
{{champion:75}} - This could work IF he has a target Withered while they are inside Spirit Fire. This would require him to commit 2 skills, a lot of mana, and plenty of CD, all just to keep his enemy from Flashing out.
{{champion:86}} - Replacing his Silence with Grounded would make him a lot healthier as a juggernaut by allowing his enemies to actually fight back. Presently, all you can do after he silences you is panic while he spins-to-win.

Suddenly half the roster doesn't invalidate his ult.
J4 needs it more than anyone else in this post...

J4 needs a skill to be given absolutely no counterplay?

You do realize that this would lead to the complete gutting of J4, right? What you're suggesting is that when people get hit by J4 POINT AND CLICK AoE ULTIMATE THAT CREATES TERRAIN, they ALSO can't use escapes to get out of the terrain... there's no way that that would get shipped without J4 getting serious nerfs to every other part of his kit.

No, please no. Nasus is already incredibly difficult to escape from thanks to his slow being massive, which means that if you don't have a long ranged dash, slow resistance, or a way to cleanse his slow, you are dead. Nasus already has incredible dueling potential. Him having a Grounded debuff would make him broken.

I was thinking if {{champion:82}} could get it on his ultimate, though. He is already pretty immobile, a way to counter mobility would help him a lot. It would also help him have a little more utility for his team during a teamfight. Imagine if he could "ground" that fed Vayne.
Morde is a juggernaut, so CC isn't really supposed to be part of his kit. Besides, that ultimate already is devastating when used properly. Snipe an enemy, and suddenly the ensuing teamfight is 6v4.

> Who else is planned to get said debuff?

Currently, no one. We're likely to see how it plays before committing to trying it on other champions. That said, it's been set up so that it would be easy to add to other champions as well.
Are there any Champions who you think it'd be appropriate on? I could definitely see {{champion:86}} getting it as a replacement for his silence. Much more fair in letting you fight back against him.
Singed W seems like a good candidate to me.
Minor question: Does the PBE version of Cass have Grounded implemented yet?
It appears that it doesn't. It looks like only a partial build went in, and it looks like the only changes were to her passive, as well as the spell descriptions (not their functionality).
Would the glue thus have its actual slow reduced by an amount? Because a straight-up buff to Singed like that is fairly unnecessary.
Repetoir, I'm going to ask that you and the reds call Grounded "Cripple."  If you don't, it's going to turn into "Root/Snare" 2.0.  We need consistency.
It's hard to say either is better, as "Cripple" could just as easily sound like a slowing effect or something.

Stagger sounds good. :)
Impaired?

It would be flavorful on Talon, but it would make him insanely strong. Overpowered, even. 

If giving his E a silence made him over-the-top, giving it grounded would make him just about as strong as silence
The issue with silence was that mages could not fight back. Grounded doesn't stop a Brand from blasting Talon in the face with Sear.

It prevents them from flashing or running away.
Leblanc is dead meat after he E's her, for instance. Ahri can no longer ult away to safety.
seems balanced. only hurts the slippery bastards.

Every change in League of Legends usually hurts only a specific group of champions. Often times, these changes are a little over the top. You're fine with one group being affected because you dislike them personally? Look, I'm sure most people dislike those champions quite a bit, but that doesn't mean they should be nerfed for that reason.

no no, they should be nerfed like this because of two reasons.

A, it means that they can receive minor buffs elsewhere in their kit.

and B, it means that there can be balance in the game.

slippery targets atm are too slippery, you either kill them instantly or they escape, which has pushed riot to make more champions capable of killing them instantly, which adversely affects non-slippery targets more than slippery targets. strong cc is in the same vein, strong against slippery targets, but stronger against non-slippery targets, due to the fact that when cc runs out an immobile champ is stuck but a mobile champ can still escape. this creates an issue where mobile champions are pretty much just better than immobile champions, even if they miss some damage or range, due to them having nearly no counter. well, here is a counter to mobility that doesn't affect immobiles very much, and due to that it's a very good thing.

I think the prevalence of other sorts of CC among most characters in the game can usually do an adequate job of dealing with dashes. I find it a little funny that people act as if some revolutionary thing happens when a CC that stops you from using mobility is added, seeing as most forms of CC stop people from using mobility as it is...
again, still better against immobile than mobile for the most part.
Honestly, I don't know why I'm arguing for less CC... I think adding grounded to some people would be pretty good honestly. It just needs to be really careful where it's put.
Karthus W is perhaps the one that needs it the most out of everyone atm
They could add it onto Leblanc's chain, since the removed the silence from it before because it didn't have enough counterplay. Now people can counter, just not with movement abilities.
It was Leblanc's Q that had the silence, not her chain.
I'd actually be fine if LB's chain grounded me, but only if they also removed the slow from it.

>They could add it onto Leblanc's chain, since the removed the silence from it before because it didn't have enough counterplay.

I think you're very close to having a point here, you just missed it by a fraction. I don't think it would be bad to add an effect like this to LB's chains, as long as you removed or at least severely nerfed the slow. By doing that you'd make LB's chains more scary VS mobile champs and less of a death sentence VS immobile champs.
